sub_title: Assistant Professor at Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary:
As a researcher, lecturer, and consultant, I have 15 years of academic and professional experience. I have provided research and consultancy services for government authorities, foundations, and organizations in Europe, with a focus on the Flemish region in Belgium and the Netherlands. Currently, I am an Assistant Professor in Cultural Economics and Entrepreneurship at the Erasmus University Rotterdam. 

My teaching experience includes courses in Cultural Entrepreneurship, Management of Arts and Culture, Economics of Arts & Culture, Cultural Policy, and the Societal Impact of Arts and Creativity.

My academic interests and expertise include:
- Entrepreneurship in cultural and creative industries 
- Artistic labor markets
- Cooperation and competition
- Firm-growth
- Cooperative forms
- Finance and funding in creative sectors
- Impact of arts and creativity
- the Circular Economy
- Sustainability and justice in creative sectors

projects.title: ReCharge
projects.description:
RECHARGE stands for Resilient European Cultural Heritage As Resource for Growth and Engagement. Keywords that together synthesise the aim of the project itself: to reinvigorate community participation as added economic value for cultural heritage institutions across Europe.

Funded within the European Union's HORIZON Europe programme, the key funding programme for research and innovation within the EU, RECHARGE supports cultural heritage institutions in diversifying their funding through a replicable and sustainable participatory business model, to acquire the necessary tools for its future developments, both in the digital realm and onsite.

RECHARGE builds on new and existing communities, networks and relationships related to cultural heritage institutions, to engage them in participatory management through cultural heritage Living Labs. These labs, developed collaboratively and open to professionals and the public, aim at testing and devising innovative ways to harness resources, to ensure the development of sustainable future business models, focused on the creation and integration of value within each institution and in the sector at large.

Participation is central in every aspect of RECHARGE: from financing to planning and management, from communication and public engagement to sustainability and the future of the project itself.

https://recharge-culture.eu/

projects.title: the Self-Curating Musician: music education by design thinking (SeCuM)
projects.description: A Creative Europe project in which students, alumni and teachers of five countries (Portugal, Greece, Estonia, the Netherlands and Belgium) join forces to find solutions and formulate recommendations for a future-oriented curriculum for classically trained contemporary musicians.

projects.title: Value co-creation in circular design processes
projects.description: Increasingly more companies are ‘going circular’ and are able to develop sustainable business models. But we currently don’t know enough about the nature and challenges of the underlying processes, and about the changing roles of all the involved partners. The Value co-creation in circular design processes project will start on 6 January 2020 and will run for one year. It examines how circularity influences the processes of co-creation and adoption, and how it redefines the different partner roles, with a special focus on the designer.

VIZIER is een Nederlands-Belgisch collectief van jonge onderzoekers en praktijkdeskundigen in de culturele en creatieve economie.

VIZIER is a Dutch-Belgian collective of junior researchers and practicioners in the cultural and creative economy.

profile_positions.description:
As an Assistant Professor in Cultural Economics and Entrepreneurship at the Erasmus School of History, Culture and Communication (ESHCC) - Erasmus University Rotterdam, I lecture in the International Bachelor in Cultural Studies (IBACS), the Pre-Master in Cultural Economics and Entrepreneurship, and the Master in Cultural Economics and Entrepreneurship. 

Teaching (a.o.): Cultural and Creative Entrepreneurship I + II, Assessing the Impact of Culture and Creativity in Society, Introduction to the Economics of Arts & Culture, Research Workshop Cultural Management, Research Workshop Cultural Economics and Entrepreneurship 

https://www.eur.nl/en/people/ellen-loots
